diff_hunk:
@@ -2,12 +2,213 @@
 <html lang="en">
 <head>
   <meta charset="UTF-8">
-  <meta name="viewport"
-        content="width=device-width, user-scalable=no, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, minimum-scale=1.0">
+  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, user-scalable=no, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, minimum-scale=1.0">
   <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="ie=edge">
-  <title>Document</title>
+  <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Fira+Sans:300,400,600&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
+  <script src="https://kit.fontawesome.com/4a9da0928a.js" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
+  <link rel="stylesheet" href="contact.css">
+  <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Fira+Sans:wght@300;500;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
+  <link rel="stylesheet" href="./styles-home-bottom.css">
+  <link rel="stylesheet" href="home.css">
+  <title>Home</title>
 </head>
 <body>
body:
Hi! You can try to standardize the use of `headings` and `sections` to have a clearer document outline. Right now looks like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23508800/77828287-7112c300-70e8-11ea-85e0-808f01fc73fb.png)
For example, in the section `Services`, the title should be "Services" or "We love work hard...". Maybe there is not a 'correct' answer but you most be consistent with your choice throughout the entire document.

diff_hunk:
@@ -2,12 +2,213 @@ - + - Document + + + + + + + Home -

Hello world!

+
+ + + +
+ +
+

Work around you and your team

+

From ads that dance or sing to MTV-like commercials, online advertisers are now using a new type of technology “rich media” to attract consumers.

+ get started + +
+
+ +
+
+ +
+ + +
+
+ +
+
+

We solve digital problems with an outstanding creative flare

+

The best time to view the moon, obviously, is at night when there are few clouds and the weather is accommodating for a long and lasting study.

+

For most of us, the idea of astronomy is something we directly connect to “stargazing”, telescopes and seeing magnificent displays in the heavens.

+
+ +
+

Denis Shepovalov

+ Co-Founder & CEO +
+
+
+
+

— Services

+
+
+

We love work hard and explore new things that’s why we cover lot of things. Check our service list and view details

+ +
+
+
    +
  • Multimedia
    • +
  • Interactive design
    • +
  • Packaging
    • +
  • Branding
    • +
+
    +
  • Creative Strategy
    • +
  • UI/UX
    • +
  • Coding
    • +
+
+
+ +
+
+ + +
+
+
+
+ +
+
+ +
+
+

Well thought with super easy to use

+

As we approached the palace I could see through the great windows of the first floor the brilliantly illuminated audience chamber of Than Kosis. The immense hall was crowded with nobles and their women.

+
+ +

Ultimate Result

+
+
+ +

Minimal Design

+
+
+
+ + + + + +
+

- Our Works
body: You can consolidate some elements when merging your individual files. This line can benefits from the class `serviH3` (that could have a better name as well). Here you can define if you will use a `heading` element as `h3` or just a `paragraph`.

body: Same here, using an `h1` inside a regular `div` means that this is the main title of the page. You can use multiples `h1` but always inside a `sectioning` element as `article` or `section`

body: Remember that HTML is for structure and not presentation. Here you are using blank spaces in W` `O` `R` `K` `E` `D trying to separate each letter a little bit. That is entirely presentational an should be accomplished using CSS. Here you only need `- We worked with`. Try it! 😎

body: This `textarea` should be connected to the `label`, right?
This class is being used?
It is not a best practice using `id` selectors for styling. Try to change it for a class or another type of selector 🙏🏼

If you give a specific width to the body, how will it look on bigger screens?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23508800/77830040-b7215400-70f3-11ea-9e39-ad9fa46e3fbc.png)
You need a wrapper for all the content but is not the body. The body should have a background color to avoid white space on bigger screens.

Avoid styling root elements at any cost 🙏 

root styles are hard to override and can have unexpected effects as a project grows

body:
`anchor` cannot be used to send a form. You need to use a `button` with type `submit` or an input with `type` submit.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/submit
Good job! (just testing)
